page.title: 09Coathamstob Brick Works
page.content: The brickworks are owned by Westbrick and employ 88 people.The local clay reserves date from the ice age over 1 million years ago.A conveyor belt brings the clay from a stock pile to be checked for stones.Anything larger than 0.8mm is crushed into powder. The clay is then mixed with water, passed through a compacting machine from which it emerges as a solid column and is then cut into individual bricks. They are dried for about 2 days in ovens using hot air from the kilns. The temperature in the 18 kilns, fired by gas is slowly raised to 1000c to bake 53,000 bricks at a time.Cooling takes 3 or 4 days and production is half a million per week and 25m. annually.
